Background
// FILE.009 [Gehenna Academy]

Freedom, chaos, and trouble!

That is the word for Gehenna Academy. "I don't care about the rules, it's already hard because there are a lot of illegal circles!" Because it is such a school, there are many students who are good or bad.

However, because of that, the reputation from other schools is ...

General Information
Gehenna Academy is one of the largest and oldest schools in Kivotos. Its culture runs along the concept of "Freedom and Chaos". Because of this, many troublesome clubs or groups (e.g., Problem Solver 68) exist and use the main building and club building whenever and however they please. This has forced the other students to study in only select areas of the campus.

Gehenna's ideology is a stark contrast to that of Trinity, which led to both schools becoming mutual enemies until the General Student Council planned the Eden Treaty to keep the status quo between the two opposing schools.

Trivia
"Gehenna" refers to a location in historical Jerusalem, known as the Valley of Hinnom. It is known as Gehenna in the Aramaic language, which then was translated to the word 'Hell' in the Bible, which is one of the reasons why Gehenna students have devil-like traits such as horns and devil tails.
Gehenna students exclusively use German-made firearms. This extends to their vehicles as well.
This also extends to their uniforms taking inspirations from Imperial German Army uniforms, Wehrmacht and Schutzstaffel uniforms, and German Bundeswehr uniforms.
Gehenna was originally supposed to have their own chapter during Volume 3: Eden Treaty. However, plans changed as the team realized they did not have enough time to implement it. Whether this means they will be added to the volume at a later date or recieve their own remains unknown. [1]
Both Umika and Shizuko of Hyakkiyako's Festival Management Committee reference one of Gehenna's Traditional festivities that allegedly once involved "shooting at each other with live rounds [1]until their bodies are soaked red in blood" (which in reality was an exaggerated historical depiction a Helmet Gang member told to Umika during her time in Gehenna), and is now currently reformed with a more harmless alternative, replacing bullets with tomatoes. In real life, it references the spanish festival known as "La Tomatina".
Alongside Highlander Railroad Academy and Arius Branch School, they are one of the few schools to not have any students with animal characteristics.
